content: so @XAMPPRocky, the signing stuff was prompted by me wanting to do some refactorings to the release process

namely:

  • moving it away from RCS into ephemeral VMs
  • moving the signing to a place where we can get a audit trail
  • while I'm working on it, implement windows codesigning
I don't think I'm going to work on macOS notarization right away: it's a huge pain like everything apple-related (as you can only do it on macOS), and it doesn't benefit us much for now
I remember we discussed using Mozilla’s signing thing but i don’t remember what it’s called or what if any kind of decision was made.
the recommended way to install and use rust from macOS is to curl | bash rustup, and that doesn't involve notarization checks
I might have news on that soon :slight_smile:
(feel free to PM me if you can't discuss it publicly, I'd be eager to know that)
while on windows it's actually a problem since rustup is downloaded from browsers, triggering a smartscreen warning
